name: axaddcl
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cc))

stmt.origin: fovcl(c0, cc, c1, cc, caddc, cc)
stmt.pretty: fovcl(c0, cc, c1, cc, caddc, cc)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cc))
-| wf(caddc, cxp(cc, cc), cc)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cc))
-| wf(caddc, cxp(cc, cc), cc)
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cc))

comment: Closure law for addition of complex numbers. Axiom 4 of 22 for real and complex numbers, derived from ZF set theory. This construction-dependent theorem should not be referenced directly, nor should the proven axiom ~ ax-addcl be used later. Instead, in most cases use ~ addcl . (Contributed by NM, 14-Jun-1995.) (New usage is discouraged.)
